title: Daily Briefing: IRS melts as tax season blooms
shortDescription: The federal tax agency's busiest time comes amid mass worker departures. Here's Wednesday news to know.

title: Biden gives first post-presidency speech
shortDescription: Former President Joe Biden, in his first public remarks since leaving office, criticized the Trump administrationâ€™s handling of Social Security.

title: Joe Biden accuses Trump of 'taking a hatchet' to Social Security
shortDescription: Former President Biden accused Donald Trump of "taking a hatchet" to the Social Security Administration as he made a return to the national stage.

title: Joe Biden makes first major speech since leaving office
shortDescription: President Joe Biden spoke during a conference of the Advocates, Counselors and Representatives for the Disabled (ACRD) in Chicago on April 15, 2025.

title: Can Harvard afford to defy Trump?
shortDescription: The Trump administration has vowed to freeze more than $2 billion in funds for the nation's most prestigious college. Harvard is fighting back.

title: See how Trump blinged out the Oval Office he inherited from Biden
shortDescription: Each president makes the Oval Office in the White House their own. See some of the differences between Biden and Trump.

title: Whistleblower: DOGE may have caused 'significant cyber breach' at NLRB
shortDescription: A whistleblower complaint says Elon Musk's team were given extraordinarily sweeping access to the NLRB's systems, including to sensitive case files.

title: US judge scraps Biden-era rule capping credit card late fees at $8
shortDescription: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau agreed with opponents that the rule adopted during President Joe Biden's administration was illegal.

title: Trump blames Zelenskyy of starting Russia's war against Ukraine
shortDescription: The war began when Russia invaded Ukraine. But in the Oval Office, President Trump lit into Biden and Zelenskyy and said: "Everybody's to blame."

title: Trump threatens to revoke Harvard's tax-exempt status; feud escalates
shortDescription: The comments are the latest volley in an escalating battle between the White House and one of the nation's most prestigious colleges.

title: Democrats plan El Salvador trip seeking Kilmar Abrego Garcia release
shortDescription: Sen. Chris Van Hollen and other lawmakers say the sheet metal worker was 'illegally abducted' and that they will trek to Central America for answers.

title: Trump administration freezes Harvard funding
shortDescription: President Donald Trump has threatened to freeze federal funding for multiple elite universities if they do not adhere to his demands.

title: Trump floats deporting Americans to El Salvador
shortDescription: President Trump told El Salvador's president he wants to send "homegrown criminals" to be incarcerated. Experts say that would be unconstitutional.

title: Obama praises Harvard for resisting Trump's 'ham-handed' crackdown
shortDescription: Former President Barack Obama applauded his law school alma mater for rejecting the Trump administration's conditions to "stifle academic freedom."

title: Trump administration sued over tariffs in US Court of International Trade
shortDescription: A legal advocacy group asked the U.S. Court of International Trade to block President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs on foreign trading partners,.

title: Trump calls for sending US 'homegrown criminals' to El Salvador
shortDescription: President Trump on Monday suggested U.S. citizens who commit violent crimes could be sent to El Salvador, saying "homegrowns are next."

title: Greene bought stock during dip, before Trump paused tariffs
shortDescription: The Republican congresswoman profited from the timely purchase.

title: Judge warns 'constitutional crisis' looms in deportation case
shortDescription: U.S. District Judge William Sessions suggested he may order authorities to move Rumeysa Ozturk from the Louisiana detention center.

title: Trump to cut State Department by half, slash foreign aid 75%
shortDescription: President Donald Trump's administration wants to halve the State Department budget, cutting more than $30 billion, sources said.
